summary: Email from a paralegal specialist at the U.S. Attorney's Office to an FBI agent requesting the return of a box of hard drives containing original and working copies from Epstein devices. The drives were used in a responsiveness review for discovery in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, and the defense has questions about the produced files.

persons.name: Sunny Drescher
persons.context: Author of the email requesting the return of hard drives from Epstein devices for the Maxwell case discovery review.

persons.name: Amanda Nicole Young
persons.context: Recipient of the email, referred to as 'Mandy', from whom the hard drives are being requested.

persons.name: William Bohrer
persons.context: Copied on the email regarding the hard drive request.

persons.name: Annie Phifer
persons.context: Copied on the email regarding the hard drive request.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defense for Maxwell has raised questions about the files produced from the Epstein device review, prompting the need to re-examine the hard drives.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The hard drives originate from devices belonging to Epstein, used in the investigation.

connections.description: Drescher is requesting the return of hard drives from Young, indicating a working relationship between the U.S. Attorney's Office and the FBI on the case.
Both are associated with the U.S. Attorney's Office and copied on the same case-related email.
Both are associated with the U.S. Attorney's Office and copied on the same case-related email.
Maxwell's defense is questioning files from Epstein's devices, linking them in the legal case.

events.title: Email Request for Hard Drives
events.description: Sunny Drescher emails Amanda Young to request the return of a box of hard drives from Epstein devices to address defense questions in the Maxwell case.

events.title: Massive Search Warrant Responsiveness Review
events.description: A review was conducted on all Epstein devices, resulting in the production of images and videos for the Maxwell case.

locations.context: Location of the U.S. Attorney's Office where Sunny Drescher works.

keyFacts: A box of hard drives containing original data and working copies from Jeffrey Epstein's devices was provided to the FBI after a massive search warrant responsiveness review in the fall.
The defense for Ghislaine Maxwell has raised questions about the files produced from these hard drives, prompting the U.S. Attorney's Office to request their return for verification.
The email indicates ongoing discovery issues and the need to resolve questions about the evidence produced in the Maxwell case.
The correspondence highlights the collaborative but procedural relationship between the U.S. Attorney's Office and the FBI in managing physical evidence.
The hard drives contain images and videos that were produced for the Maxwell case, underscoring the digital evidence central to the prosecution.
